bibl.title: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Maria Teresa Rojas, August 30, 1951

div1.p: Hench informs Rojas that he is coming to Cuba in about five months for a medical congress. He asks her advice about hotels and indicates that he would like to see her.

div1.head: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Maria Teresa Rojas, August 30, 1951
div1.opener:
August 30, 1951
Senorita Maria Teresa Rojas
Quinta San Jose
Calle Real
Quemados de Marianao
Habana, Cuba
My dear Senorita Rojas:
div1.p:
Mrs. Hench and I are hoping to come to Cuba with two
friends, Doctor and Mrs. Gray, in January. I shall
be attending a medical congress in Havana the week
of January 20 to 26 and then we hope to rest for a
week, perhaps at the Varadero Beach. Doctor Gray is
bringing his car and we hope to drive there for the
week of January 27.

I have heard of two or three hotels and wondered if
you could give me some advice as to which would be
perhaps the nicest. I have heard of the new Hotel
Varadera Internacional. Do you know anything about
it? Also the Casa La Rosa has been recommended.
We want a quiet place where we can just rest com-
pletely but we do like nice hotels.

I do hope that you will be home during the week of
January 20. We would so much like to see you.
div1.closer: Sincerely yours, P. S. Hench, M.D. PSH:alc
